subject: Relationships
title: Red Flags You Shouldn't Ignore
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Red Flags You Shouldn't Ignore.

hook.text: They isolate you from friends. They check your phone. They punish you with silence. These aren't quirks.

buildup.text: Researchers identified early red flags: jealousy disguised as caring, rushing commitment, and contempt in conflict.

discovery.text: The biggest predictor of future abuse is how someone handles the word 'no.' Healthy partners respect boundaries.

twist.text: Many red flags feel like romance at first: intense jealousy feels like passion, control feels like protection.

climax.text: Red flags don't turn green with time. They turn darker. Trust the early warnings your gut already noticed.

punchline.text: Red flags don't improve with time. They intensify. Trust your gut.

quiz.question: What is the biggest predictor of future abuse?
